author: Emily Brooks
description: Senate Democrats are resisting calls from the nation’s largest union representing federal workers — a longtime political ally — to accept Republicans’ “clean” stopgap to re-open the government. It is the latest display of how outside pressure and deadlines have failed to move the parties away from their entrenched positions surrounding Democrats’ demands to negotiate…
title: Democrats vote against ‘clean’ GOP bill to end shutdown despite union pressure

author: Ryan Mancini
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) on Tuesday urged donors to stop giving money toward the state’s redistricting measure planned to go for a vote on Nov. 4. An email from Newsom to donors obtained by The Hill notes that the governor’s team has “hit our budget goals and raised what we need in order to…
title: Newsom to donors: Stop giving money for redistricting effort

author: Tara Suter
description: Almost two-thirds of Americans disapprove of President Trump’s White House ballroom plan, according to a new poll. In the Yahoo/YouGov poll, 61 percent of respondents said they did not support Trump’s plan to add a ballroom, while 25 percent backed the move. The demolition of the East Wing of the White House to leave space…
title: Nearly two-thirds of Americans disapprove of Trump’s White House ballroom plan: Poll

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: New York City Democratic mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani holds a commanding lead over former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D), who is running as an independent, according to a new poll released one week before Election Day. The five-day Manhattan Institute survey, which closed on Sunday, shows Mamdani leading with 43 percent of likely voters’…
title: Mamdani holds wide lead over Cuomo in new poll

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Elon Musk launched Grokipedia on Monday as an alternative to the nonprofit-powered Wikipedia.  Musk’s version is backed by xAI, but still uses Wikipedia as a source on most subjects. The subsections and citations on Grokipedia resemble that of its predecessor but refrain from reporting on topics critical of Musk, its maker.  For example, no mention…
title: Musk launches Grokipedia, AI-powered alternative to Wikipedia

author: Tara Suter
description: Ben & Jerry’s co-founder Ben Cohen claimed Tuesday that Unilever stopped the company from creating an ice cream “flavor for Palestine.” “Unilever / Magnum stopped Ben & Jerry’s from creating a flavor for Palestine — so I’m doing it myself,” Cohen said in a post Tuesday on social platform X. “I’ve got a watermelon, an…
title: Ben & Jerry’s co-founder claims Unilever stopped ‘flavor for Palestine’

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Health policy experts on Tuesday urged the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) to boost staffing, noting that the government shutdown has only hindered services.  This staffing shortage couldn’t have come at a worse time, as open enrollment for Medicare plans began earlier this month.  “We don’t have the infrastructure right now in place…
title: Medicare staffing raises alarm with open enrollment underway

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: If “America First” now includes importing cheaper beef to pressure U.S. ranchers on price, the slogan loses meaning.
title: Trump undercuts American ranchers, scrambles to import Argentina beef

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell has a bold plan for what his party should do if it takes back power in 2028: Bulldoze President Trump’s new ballroom!   Seriously, I’m not making this up. He recently wrote on X: “Don’t even think of seeking the Democratic nomination for president unless you pledge to take a wrecking ball…
title: Eric Swalwell says Dems must vow to destroy Trump’s ballroom

author: Addy Bink
description: Hurricane Melissa, one of the strongest Atlantic storms on record, has made landfall in Jamaica.
title: Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm: Will it impact the US?

author: Ryan Mancini
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) on Tuesday dismissed any stand-alone bills seeking to pay federal workers or fund assistance programs during the government shutdown. These bills stretch from providing federal workers with their salaries to funding the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), with no benefits issued starting Nov. 1. “We voted Sept. 19 to fund…
title: Johnson: Stand-alone SNAP, federal salary bills a ‘waste of our time’

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: House Democratic leaders signaled they are not shifting their position on the shutdown a day after the nation’s largest federal workers union urged them to back a “clean” funding measure to open the government. The Democrats said they empathize with the workers represented by the American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE), but that ending the…
title: Democrats brush off shutdown pressure from union, saying end depends on GOP

author: Julie Marzouk, opinion contributor
description: When voters elect city council members, they do not expect to be taking a stand on international conflicts.
title: Democratic Socialists want to shift local politics from potholes to Palestine

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) told reporters Tuesday that there would be “strong” support within the Senate Republican conference for a proposal offered to Democrats by Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) to pay all federal workers — both essential and furloughed — during the government shutdown. Democrats will be under pressure to support the proposal…
title: Thune: ‘Strong’ GOP support for paying all federal workers during shutdown

author: Ava Hart
description: A 58-year-old man died at the last rappel of Zion National Park's Pine Creek Canyon on Sunday afternoon.
title: Rappeller dies in Zion National Park canyon in Utah

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Sen Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.) on Monday said he hopes Republicans investigate why corporations donated funds to go towards President Trump’s ballroom, set to be constructed adjacent to the White House where the East Wing once stood. CNN’s Kaitlan Collins asked Blumenthal that the corporate donors won’t “tell a senator if there’s an implicit agreement with…
title: Blumenthal ‘hoping’ some Republicans will demand answers on ballroom donors

author: Max Rego
description: California Attorney General Rob Bonta (D) said Monday that the state will monitor the Department of Justice’s (DOJ) election observers ahead of next week’s general election.  During a virtual news conference, Bonta said that observers will provide “oversight and accountability” of the federal monitors, according to KCRA in Sacramento. “[The federal monitors] will not be…
title: California to deploy election observers to counter DOJ during redistricting vote

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The Senate Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation is requesting information from NBA Commissioner Adam Silver about how he plans to address a massive gambling scandal that rocked the league as it opened it season this month. In a letter dated Monday, the committee said its members have become concerned “sports betting scandals like this…
title: Senate wants answers from NBA commissioner on gambling scandal

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) mocked conservative activist Riley Gaines, a former college athlete, for finishing in fifth place in her last competitive college swim meet. The New York Democrat’s post came in response to Gaines accusing Ocasio-Cortez and her progressive allies of destroying the country, kicking off a pointed exchange between the outspoken political figures.…
title: Ocasio-Cortez mocks Riley Gaines for fifth place finish

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: President Trump urged a New York appeals court late Monday to overturn his hush money criminal conviction, insisting the judge should’ve recused and excluded evidence Trump asserts is protected by presidential immunity.  “This is the most politically charged prosecution in our Nation’s history,” Trump’s lawyers wrote.  A jury convicted Trump last year on 34 felony…
title: Trump urges appeals court to toss hush money conviction

author: Julia Manchester
description: The National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) rolled out a memo Tuesday detailing how Republicans plan to “weaponize” a  likely New York City mayoral win from Zohran Mamdani against Democrats in next year’s midterm elections.  In the two-page memo, House Republicans label Mamdani a “socialist” and argue House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries’s (D-N.Y.) endorsement of him last…
title: House Republicans detail plans to tie House Democrats to Mamdani

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Illinois’ Democratic congressional delegation urged the state legislature on Tuesday to consider implementing a new House map as both parties ramp up efforts to redraw their congressional lines ahead of the 2026 midterms.  “Donald Trump and House Republicans have concluded that the only way to keep their weak majority is by stealing congressional seats in…
title: Illinois Democrats urge state legislature to consider new House map

author: Joseph Bosco, opinion contributor
description: Trump may not appreciate the comparison, but his erratic policy shifts partially mirror former President Biden’s own vacillations on the proper response to Putin’s aggression.
title: Trump needs to step up and get serious about Ukraine

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and GOP leaders will speak with reporters Tuesday as pressure rises on lawmakers to reopen the government after funding lapsed nearly a month ago. Johnson’s latest remarks, which have become an almost daily ritual since the shutdown began, come a day after Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) seemingly offered an olive…
title: Watch live: Johnson gives remarks on Day 28 of government shutdown

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: If you weren’t able to stay awake to watch the end of Game 3 of the World Series, you’re not the only one. Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) posted on social media Tuesday morning about waking up in the middle of the night to find Los Angeles Dodgers slugger Freddie Freeman had ended Game 3…
title: DeSantis jokes about sleeping through end of World Series game

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Russia’s second-largest oil producer on Monday said it decided to sell off assets amid wide-reaching sanctions from the United States. “The consideration of bids from potential purchasers has been started,” Lukoil wrote in a statement on its website. The company said it would work to meet the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control’s Nov. 21…
title: US sanctions push Russian oil giant Lukoil to sell off assets

author: Nick Daniels, opinion contributor
description: These highly-skilled aviation safety professionals are bracing for their first missed paycheck today.
title: ‘A big, fat zero’ for air traffic controllers should be unacceptable

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump early Tuesday threatened to send more troops to cities amid his crackdown on crime, telling U.S. service members in Japan that some may need “more than the National Guard.”  “We have cities in trouble. We can’t have cities that have trouble,” Trump said, speaking to troops on the USS George Washington at the…
title: Trump threatens to send ‘more than National Guard’ to US cities

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia Democrats are bracing for the possibility of split-ticket results in the governor and attorney general races, which could pose a significant impact on policy and issues like redistricting. While former Rep. Abigail Spanberger (D-Va.) continues to hold a lead over Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears (R), the attorney general’s race is increasingly looking like a…
title: Virginia Democrats brace for split-ticket result amid Jay Jones fallout

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Two years after the Supreme Court ruled to abolish affirmative action in higher education admissions, Black enrollment at selective universities is down, Asian American enrollment is up and the implications of the decision are becoming clearer.   An analysis by The Associated Press of 20 elite schools shows the drastic effect the 2023 high court decision had on enrollment, with some institutions seeing their…
title: Colleges feel the weight of Supreme Court affirmative action decision as Black enrollment falls

author: Surina Venkat
description: The nation’s top schools have ramped up their spending on lobbying the federal government this year amid President Trump’s crackdown on higher education, disclosures filed last week show. Twenty-four top universities and one of the nation’s largest college systems have already spent around $24 million lobbying Washington this year, more than double what they spent…
title: Top universities ramp up lobbying amid Trump higher education crackdown

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Beginning Saturday, Americans will be able to log into the federal Affordable Care Act exchange and choose their insurance plans for next year. Nov. 1. has been a key date in the shutdown fight, as Democrats have long argued that if the enhanced federal subsidies aren’t renewed by that point, the impact on consumers will…
title: What to know about ACA open enrollment
